translation.en: [narrator] From the late '80s onward, hip-hop was dominated by two regions,
translation.ja: 80年代以降ヒップホップを制覇(せいは)したのは

translation.en: the East and the West.
translation.ja: 東と西

translation.en: [narrator] But Atlanta's rise in the mid '90s marked the start of a new chapter in hip-hop.
translation.ja: 90年代 アトランタで新たな幕が開けた

translation.en: A power shift to the South
translation.ja: 南部へ力が移り

translation.en: that was rooted in regional pride, and shaped by indigenous influences.
translation.ja: 地元のプライドと土着の影響で形成された

translation.en: Because, all across the South,
translation.ja: 南部では 型破りのＤＪやＭＣたちが―

translation.en: free from preconceptions of what hip-hop could be or should be,
translation.ja: 型破りのＤＪやＭＣたちが―

translation.en: DJs, MCS and producers were creating the future of hip-hop...
translation.ja: ヒップホップの未来を作っていた

translation.en: including here: New Orleans.
translation.ja: ここニューオーリンズでも

translation.en: New Orleans is a musical place, it's a magical place
translation.ja: ここには音楽の魔法がある ここには音楽の魔法があるマスターＰラッパー ここには音楽の魔法がある

translation.en: when you talk about musicians. You can find one on every corner.
translation.ja: 街中にミュージシャンがいる

translation.en: [male] You have so much mixture of different types of music in the city.
translation.ja: 様々な音楽の融合をガンボと呼ぶ

translation.en: We call it "gumbo." You put a lot of different flavors in it, man,
translation.ja: 様々な音楽の融合をガンボと呼ぶＤＪジュビリー ＤＪジュビリー ＤＪジュビリー色んな味のミックスさ

translation.en: and you get one big pot out of it.
translation.ja: 色んな味のミックスさ

translation.en: [DJ Jubilee] It makes New Orleans unique, and people just wanna be a part of it.
translation.ja: 誰もが参加したがる

translation.en: [narrator] As the birthplace of jazz and the home of Mardi Gras, NOLA was bound to touch hip-hop.
translation.ja: ジャズとマルディグラの発祥地ＮＯＬＡ(ニューオーリンズ)では―

translation.en: This is a city where music underscores everything.
translation.ja: 全ての音楽が背景にある

translation.en: Because in New Orleans, there's music in life, and there's music in death.
translation.ja: 音楽が生と死と共にある場所

translation.en: [Charlie] It's important to understand
translation.ja: ここはアメリカで一番アフリカ化された街

translation.en: that New Orleans is the most Africanized city in America.
translation.ja: ここはアメリカで一番アフリカ化された街チャーリー·ブラクストン ここはアメリカで一番アフリカ化された街

translation.en: Because the French were very lax with the slaves,
translation.ja: フランス人は奴隷に対して緩かったから

translation.en: the Africans who were brought here were able to retain a lot of African culture.
translation.ja: ここへ来た奴隷はアフリカ文化を守れたんだ

translation.en: In African culture, we don't look at death as "the end,"
translation.ja: アフリカ文化では死は終わりじゃない

translation.en: we look at it as the next phase,
translation.ja: アフリカ文化では死は終わりじゃない 次のステージ

translation.en: and you're supposed to celebrate that.
translation.ja: それを祝福する

translation.en: [Charlie] "Second line" is based on a New Orleans jazz funeral,
translation.ja: セカンドラインはジャズ葬が由来のパレード

translation.en: where you have the band leading the family down to the grave site.
translation.ja: セカンドラインはジャズ葬が由来のパレード バンドが家族を墓まで率いる

translation.en: That's the first line, is the family and the band, and it's very somber.
translation.ja: １列(ファーストライン)目は家族とバンドで悲しい雰囲気

translation.en: And, on the way back, whoever else joins in,
translation.ja: 後ろの方は誰でも参加できる

translation.en: that becomes the second line
translation.ja: それがセカンドライン

translation.en: and it's really a party.
translation.ja: パーティーだ

translation.en: The second line is like a magnet.
translation.ja: 磁石みたいに大勢がついて行って 磁石みたいに大勢がついて行ってケイティー·レッド

translation.en: You draw all kinds of people in and they all walk in the streets together,
translation.ja: 磁石みたいに大勢がついて行ってケイティー·レッド 磁石みたいに大勢がついて行って

translation.en: like, in one big ol' pile.
translation.ja: １つになる

translation.en: [DJ Jubilee] It's how we end off a party, with a great second line, baby. -[interviewer] That's it. -[DJ Jubilee] Oh. Watch out, y'all.
translation.ja: セカンドラインは盛大なパーティーの閉幕だよ

translation.en: [male] If you go to the second line, as the band's playing,
translation.ja: バンドの演奏に合わせて

translation.en: a couple of people will pick up something and play with them.
translation.ja: ＫＬＣプロデューサーみんな何か拾って弾き始める みんな何か拾って弾き始める

translation.en: I don't care if it's a bottle or a stick, a screwdriver hitting on a stop sign,
translation.ja: ボトルや棒ドライバーで標識を叩いたり

translation.en: they will find something just to be part of what the band's doing.
translation.ja: 何かしら探してバンドに参加する

translation.en: New Orleans is just related to music, and it's just our DNA.
translation.ja: 音楽は僕らのＤＮＡの中にある

translation.en: [Mia X] We move to a different beat in New Orleans.
translation.ja: ここのビートは違う

translation.en: The influence of the Mardi Gras Indians,
translation.ja: マルディグラインディアンや―ミアＸラッパー マルディグラインディアンや―

translation.en: and the second line bands are in us every time we get ready to write a rhyme. What it is, is a lot of chanting.
translation.ja: セカンドラインの影響で繰り返す詠唱(チャント)が多い

translation.en: [interviewer] Call and response is a big part of it, right?
translation.ja: コール＆レスポンス

translation.en: [female] I love it. I'm about to show you what it is.
translation.ja: 見せてあげる

translation.en: Alright.
translation.ja: ああ

translation.en: When I say "Cheeky," you say "Blakk."
translation.ja: チーキーと言ったらブラックと言ってチーキー·ブラック チーキーと言ったらブラックと言って

translation.en: -I'm Cheeky. -Blakk.
translation.ja: チーキーと言ったらブラックと言って ブラック

translation.en: -I'm Cheeky. -Blakk.
translation.ja: ブラック

translation.en: -We rockin', we rollin' with Cheeky. -Blakk.
translation.ja: チーキーとロック

translation.en: -You movin', you groovin' with Cheeky. -Blakk.
translation.ja: チーキーとグルーヴ

translation.en: I love the way you really sing it with Cheeky.
translation.ja: チーキーと歌って

translation.en: -Blakk. -Twerk up.
translation.ja: ブラック

translation.en: -I forgot that one already. -Twerk something. Something... I already forgot it.
translation.ja: 忘れちゃったよ

translation.en: It all connects: the Mardi Gras Indians,
translation.ja: マルディグラやセカンドライン マルディグラやセカンドラインビッグ·フリーディア

translation.en: the second line sound.
translation.ja: マルディグラやセカンドラインビッグ·フリーディア

translation.en: You heard all that good stuff like that at block parties. And it's the beat.
translation.ja: ブロックパーティーでよく聞くビート

translation.en: It's the beat that gets the feet moving, and the hands clapping, and the people jumping.
translation.ja: 足と手が動いてジャンプしたくなるビート

translation.en: On that note, block parties here, were they a big thing when you were growing up?
translation.ja: ブロックパーティーをして育った？

translation.en: Oh, most definitely.
translation.ja: もちろん

translation.en: You say they got a block party here, everybody meeting at that location.
translation.ja: パーティーの噂で人が集まって

translation.en: You got guys on motorbikes, you got girls in their high shorts.
translation.ja: バイク男やホットパンツ女に―

translation.en: Wherever the girls go, the fellas will follow.
translation.ja: 男たちもついて来た

translation.en: [Mia X] Block parties really used to be in the projects, you know. We used to call it the DJ,
translation.ja: よく公営住宅で行われてＤＪと呼んでた

translation.en: and that's how a lot of DJs made a name for themselves.
translation.ja: そこからＤＪの名が広まった

translation.en: You know, the late, great Sabu,
translation.ja: 偉大な故サブ

translation.en: he was, like, one of the first mobile DJs we had in New Orleans.
translation.ja: ニューオーリンズ初の有名ＤＪよ

translation.en: He was, like, the record man, and he would pass on your block, and he would play records, and, you know,
translation.ja: 彼はブロックの前に来てレコードを流して

translation.en: he gave block parties before block parties were block parties.
translation.ja: 元祖ブロックパーティー

translation.en: Then Sabu had a baby. He was, like, a child prodigy.
translation.ja: サブの赤ちゃんは天才児で

translation.en: He could do everything at a young age.
translation.ja: 小さい頃から何でもできた

translation.en: I'm not surprised that he is one of the greatest producers in the game.
translation.ja: 彼は業界きってのプロデューサーになったわ

translation.en: His love for music was just always there.
translation.ja: ずっと音楽愛を持ってた

translation.en: He was always trying to push the envelope.
translation.ja: いつも自らに挑戦して

translation.en: [narrator] DJ Sabu rocked block parties across New Orleans, but his biggest legacy was right at home.
translation.ja: 街中を踊らせたＤＪサブの最大の功績は 家族だった

translation.en: Because, while Sabu was working the turntables, his son was watching and listening,
translation.ja: その姿を息子が見ていたからだ

translation.en: soaking up the game and learning the craft.
translation.ja: 父親のワザを吸収し―

translation.en: And, he'd apply all his knowledge to set the tone for the sound of NOLA hip-hop.
translation.ja: ＮＯＬＡ(ニューオーリンズ)ヒップホップサウンドを築いた

translation.en: My dad, Sabu, was a street DJ in New Orleans,
translation.ja: マニー·フレッシュ親父のサブはストリートＤＪで 親父のサブはストリートＤＪで

translation.en: and his performances were crazy.
translation.ja: トロフィーを持って帰って来たのを覚えてるマニー·フレッシュ

translation.en: I remember my dad used to come home with 'DJ of the Year' trophies.
translation.ja: トロフィーを持って帰って来たのを覚えてるマニー·フレッシュ トロフィーを持って帰って来たのを覚えてる

translation.en: Early on, my dad did block parties.
translation.ja: 親父がパーティーで

translation.en: I just remember my dad back-spinning Chic, "Good Times." [singing "Good Times"] ♪ Good times ♪
translation.ja: シックの“グッド·タイムズ”を回してた

translation.en: I had never heard the song before,
translation.ja: 初めて聞いた曲だったが

translation.en: but I was just like, "Whatever the fuck that is, I need to learn how to do that."
translation.ja: “そのワザを覚えたい”って思った

translation.en: That was the defining moment. That record. It was life-changing.
translation.ja: あの曲がきっかけで人生が変わったよ

translation.en: I practiced 24/7, all day, get on my mom's nerves, my dad's nerves.
translation.ja: １日中練習して両親をイラ立たせたよ

translation.en: He a DJ, but he still going, "Turn that shit off."
translation.ja: 親父もＤＪなのに“やめろ”ってね

translation.en: [Mannie Fresh] I started DJing block parties.
translation.ja: マイアミベースが流行りだした頃―

translation.en: Now, at the time, Miami bass had started jumping off.
translation.ja: マイアミベースが流行りだした頃― ＤＪを始めた

translation.en: I noticed that everybody in New Orleans loves 808 beats.
translation.ja: 地元では808ビートが人気だと気づいて―

translation.en: I started bringing my 808 drum machine to the gigs, and that caught on.
translation.ja: ドラムマシンを持って行ったら大人気

translation.en: Kids would be like, "Hey, when you gonna play the drum machine?"
translation.ja: “いつプレイするんだ？”ってね

translation.en: This is what people wanted me to do, more than DJing.
translation.ja: ＤＪより期待されたよ

translation.en: At the time, I was working at Allen Toussaint's Sea-Saint studio.
translation.ja: 当時働いてたスタジオの奴が―

translation.en: The guy in there was like, "Do you know any rappers?" And I'm like, "Yeah, I know this guy, Gregory D."
translation.ja: “ラッパー知らないか？”“グレゴリーＤって奴だ”

translation.en: So they're just like, "If y'all wanna make a song,
translation.ja: 〝曲作ってみていいぞ〞

translation.en: but it's gotta kind of sound like something New Orleans."
translation.ja: 〝ただしニューオーリンズ風〞

translation.en: This is somebody's idea of how I'm gonna merge hip-hop with jazz.
translation.ja: アイデアはヒップホップとジャズの融合

translation.en: And, I'm automatically going, "If I get a chance, I'm just gonna put some 808 drums in there."
translation.ja: 俺は808ドラムを入れてやると思った

translation.en: And I'm like, "It ain't gonna be no horns and all."
translation.ja: ホーンも入れない

translation.en: I laid the beat down, and I was like, "What if I just tripled the snares and all of that?"
translation.ja: ビートを作ってスネアをトリプルにしてみた

translation.en: The drums started sounding like, "Well, damn, that's like a New Orleans pattern."
translation.ja: ニューオーリンズのリズム

translation.en: It came from growing up here.
translation.ja: ここで生まれ育ったから

translation.en: I just turned this... this 808 drum into the New Orleans second line jazz drumming.
translation.ja: 808がセカンドラインのジャズドラムになった

translation.en: And so, Greg was like,
translation.ja: グレッグが伝統的な要素を入れた

translation.en: "I know how to make it traditional New Orleans buck jump."
translation.ja: グレッグが伝統的な要素を入れた バックジャンプ

translation.en: "Buck jump" is pretty much a dance in New Orleans. It's what you do when you second line.
translation.ja: バックジャンプはセカンドラインのダンス

translation.en: It was like, "Okay, this is what classic New Orleans wanna hear."
translation.ja: これがニューオーリンズが求めてる音

translation.en: They like, "Yeah, say something about buck jumping, about unity, keep everybody together or whatever." So, that's how this song came.
translation.ja: バックジャンプや団結そんな歌詞の曲ができた

translation.en: ♪ That Caliope ♪ ♪ Buck jump time ♪ ♪ That Melpomene ♪ ♪ Buck jump time ♪
translation.ja: 〝バックジャンプタイム〞

translation.en: [male] When I did "Buck Jump"-- Let me explain this to you.
translation.ja: “バックジャンプ”の話

translation.en: The thing about New Orleans that's so different...
translation.ja: ニューオーリンズは―

translation.en: You know how some people will claim the Eastside or the Westside?
translation.ja: 東西で分かれてるように― 東西で分かれてるように―グレゴリーＤ 東西で分かれてるように―

translation.en: They claim "wards" down here.
translation.ja: ここは区で分かれる

translation.en: Third Ward, Fourth Ward, Fifth Ward, Sixth Ward, Seventh Ward, Eighth Ward.
translation.ja: ３区 ４区 ５区 ６区

translation.en: I took the chance. I'm like, "You know what? I'm gonna talk about every project and every ward in New Orleans,
translation.ja: そこで ニューオーリンズの全ての区の話をして

translation.en: and I'm gonna make these motherfuckers lose their motherfucking mind by claiming their goddamn wards."
translation.ja: ヤローどもをブチ切れさせようと思った

translation.en: The song was huge, but every time I played the song,
translation.ja: 曲は大人気 でも毎回曲をかけるとケンカが始まる でも毎回曲をかけるとケンカが始まるＤＪキャプテンチャールズ

translation.en: a fight would start.
translation.ja: でも毎回曲をかけるとケンカが始まる

translation.en: "Buck jump time! That Caliope. Buck jump time! That--"
translation.ja: “バックジャンプタイム！”

translation.en: And the next minute, boom, everybody would be fighting.
translation.ja: すぐ殴り合いだ

translation.en: [Mannie Fresh] But, when you played this at a party, some preppy kids, they got off the dancefloor.
translation.ja: この曲がかかると金持ちのガキが出てく

translation.en: They be like, "Nah, I'm not messing with that." Like, when that played, fights.
translation.ja: “ケンカには関わらないよ”ってね

translation.en: It's like a war call.
translation.ja: 戦闘開始の合図

translation.en: When this record comes on,
translation.ja: 曲がかかると―

translation.en: anybody that you have a problem with, when that song comes on, that's the cue to go looking for him.
translation.ja: 気に食わない奴を探しに行くんだ

translation.en: "Now, we 'bout to handle this right now."
translation.ja: 〝始めるぞ〞ってね

translation.en: They used to go off, man. This ward's going against this ward. This ward's going against that ward.
translation.ja: あっちこっち区ごとに対抗し始めた

translation.en: We did the record for togetherness.
translation.ja: 団結の曲なのに

translation.en: But, we opened up a door
translation.ja: 扉を開いたんだ

translation.en: that everybody saw that, "You know what? this shit can happen down here."
translation.ja: ここでもこんなことが起きるってね

translation.en: [narrator] "Buck Jump Time" was a breakthrough for NOLA's hip-hop scene,
translation.ja: “バックジャンプ”はＮＹスタイルと―

translation.en: bridging the gap between New York-style hip-hop
translation.ja: “バックジャンプ”はＮＹスタイルと― ニューオーリンズ伝統のリズムの融合

translation.en: and New Orleans' traditional rhythms and chants.
translation.ja: ニューオーリンズ伝統のリズムの融合

translation.en: That was a logical evolution for hip-hop in The Crescent City,
translation.ja: 筋の通ったヒップホっプの進化だった

translation.en: But, sometimes hip-hop grows in unexpected ways,
translation.ja: だが 予想外の進化もある

translation.en: and for NOLA, serendipity would come in the form of an unknown record
translation.ja: 偶然発見された無名グループのレコードが―

translation.en: from an unsung rap group.
translation.ja: そのきっかけ

translation.en: "Triggerman" was just this popular song
translation.ja: 〝トリガーマン〞は

translation.en: that I started spinning.
translation.ja: 俺がよく回してた曲

translation.en: It was from New York. A shoutout to The Showboys.
translation.ja: ＮＹのショーボーイズ

translation.en: The real name of the song was "Drag Rap," but we started calling it "Triggerman"
translation.ja: 曲のタイトルは〝ドラグラップ〞だが

translation.en: because there's one of the parts in the song where he says something about "Triggerman."
translation.ja: 〝トリガーマン〞と呼んでた

translation.en: The drums was hard, and it had these crazy breaks where the snares went...
translation.ja: ハードなドラムブレイクではスネアが…

translation.en: Then, it would break down into this cool 808 beat.
translation.ja: その後クールな808ビートになる

translation.en: [Mannie Fresh] This pivotal beat changes the city.
translation.ja: 街中が夢中になった

translation.en: Everybody is jamming to it, but there's no words to it.
translation.ja: でも歌詞がない

translation.en: My dad is still DJing, right? My dad was like,
translation.ja: 親父はまだＤＪで―

translation.en: "Hey, there's this dude, T.T. Tucker, and DJ Irv.
translation.ja: Ｔ·ＴタッカーとＤＪアーヴが

translation.en: They'll come to these little spots that I'm doing, holes in the wall, and I'll just let them rock.
translation.ja: クラムでＤＪのビートに合わせて

translation.en: They jamming off some of the beats that, you know, like, you playing."
translation.ja: ジャムしてると聞いた

translation.en: [male] At Ghost Town club, DJ Irv is just doing cuts over "Triggerman,"
translation.ja: クラブでＤＪアーヴがトリガーマンをかけて

translation.en: and Tucker just gets up there and starts chanting,
translation.ja: タッカーが歌い出す

translation.en: "Where Dey At? Where Dey At? Where Dey At?"
translation.ja: 〝お前らどこだ？〞リッキーＢ 〝お前らどこだ？〞

translation.en: And, it was just chants, call and response.
translation.ja: コール＆レスポンスさ

translation.en: Whenever that record came on,
translation.ja: 曲がかかるたび

translation.en: the "Where Dey Ats," you knew, this is the Seventh Ward, where they at. You throw up the sevens, you know, "Where Dey At?
translation.ja: “お前らどこだ”って７区の合図をするんだ

translation.en: You know, that started the whole movement in New Orleans.
translation.ja: ムーブメントの始まり

translation.en: It was recorded horrible, trashy sounding,
translation.ja: 音もヒドかったけど

translation.en: but it was just so in your face.
translation.ja: 強烈な主張だったよ

translation.en: What I didn't know was this was the start of bounce music.
translation.ja: これがバウンスの始まりだったとは

translation.en: [narrator] DJ Irv's "Where Dey At?" was a lo-fi underground smash
translation.ja: ＤＪアーヴの曲のアングラなヒットで

translation.en: that introduced NOLA to the infectious "Triggerman" sample,
translation.ja: トリガーマンのサンプルを紹介し

translation.en: and the city couldn't get enough of it.
translation.ja: 街中が夢中になった

translation.en: Because, somewhere between the booming 808s and staccato percussion, the city found more than a special record.
translation.ja: 808の低音と跳ねたビートはただの名曲ではなく―

translation.en: They found bounce music.
translation.ja: バウンスを生んだ

translation.en: ♪ We got New Orleans in the house tonight ♪
translation.ja: バウンス

translation.en: [interviewer] Yes, sir.
translation.ja: ウッス

translation.en: [male] Hey, what's up, man? What's up?
translation.ja: 調子どうだ

translation.en: [interviewer] Obviously, "Triggerman" was an important record for the evolution of bounce music.
translation.ja: トリガーマンはバウンスのきっかけ

translation.en: What did you think when you first heard that record?
translation.ja: 初めて聞いた時の印象は？

translation.en: Well, we always kind of had it in rotation, playing here.
translation.ja: いつもヘビロテで流してた いつもヘビロテで流してたＤＪジミー いつもヘビロテで流してた

translation.en: I was the DJ.
translation.ja: 俺はＤＪで

translation.en: It was really nothing but "Triggerman." It was hours and hours of nothing but that one loop.
translation.ja: 何時間もあの曲をループしてたよ

translation.en: And how did you hone your skills as far as getting on the mic
translation.ja: そこからどうやって マイクで客に呼びかけるようになった？

translation.en: and getting the crowd participation?
translation.ja: マイクで客に呼びかけるようになった？

translation.en: The girls who would come and used to...
translation.ja: マイクで客に呼びかけるようになった？ 賞金500ドルの腰振りコンテストがあった

translation.en: [DJ Jubilee] My style came different, because I was the only one really dancing.

translation.en: I used to DJ at high school, and we started doing dances, and challenges and stuff.

translation.en: I came up with the first dance, "Do The Jubilee." I was sliding side to side, "Do The Jubilee."

translation.en: Then, the next week, somebody came with another dance, the "Beanie Weenie."

translation.en: And, like, growing up in New Orleans, you hear the music, you know, coming up as a child,

translation.en: like, one, two, three years old, like, your parents gonna try to, "You better do it! Bend over! Shake!"

translation.en: You know, they, like, teach you how to do it.

translation.ja: みんな壁についたり

translation.en: "Get on the table," you know.
translation.ja: ママＤＤＪジミーの母テーブルや椅子に乗ったり テーブルや椅子に乗ったり

translation.ja: テーブルや椅子に乗ったり 足を上げたり前にかがんだり

translation.en: You know, if you don't feel it when the music playing, you'll never get it.

translation.en: [Mia X] First, it was Jimi, then it was Jubilee, then it was me.

translation.en: I was one of the first girls to put a bounce record out.

translation.en: So, once I didn't like what they were saying,

translation.ja: それが私たち女子はイヤで それが私たち女子はイヤで マグノリア·ショーティー マグノリア·ショーティー

translation.en: [Charles] Bounce was the dominant form of hip-hop in New Orleans.
translation.ja: チーキー·ブラックニューオーリンズのヒップホップの主流が― ニューオーリンズのヒップホップの主流が―

translation.en: If you weren't doing bounce,

translation.en: you had a hard time, you know, finding a big, mass audience in this city. It was...

translation.en: It was that powerful.

translation.en: All you had to do was just say the right shit, and don't fuck up.

translation.en: [male] Bounce music became our own thing because we started feeling like,

translation.en: "We don't care what the rest of the world doing, we're gonna do what we do."

translation.en: We didn't care how big you were in the world.
translation.ja: 世界の大物でも 世界の大物でもミスター·ミーナ＆カンゴ·スリム

translation.en: When you come to our city, it's us.
translation.ja: ミスター·ミーナ＆カンゴ·スリム ミスター·ミーナ＆カンゴ·スリムこの街では俺らの方がビックだぞ この街では俺らの方がビックだぞ

translation.en: We were just as big, bigger than you.

translation.en: We were cocky, man. [laughing]

translation.en: Super cocky.

translation.en: [Big Freedia] It's something that people can get into, and have fun,

translation.en: and not think about their problems at the time.

translation.en: This is the music that we make through our everyday struggle.

translation.en: [narrator] The energetic, party-oriented tempo of bounce gave NOLA a signature sound
translation.ja: ジャズなど ＮＯＬＡ(ニューオーリンズ)の伝統から誕生したバウンスは

translation.en: that was rooted in the city's rich jazz and second line tradition.
translation.ja: 独自のサウンドになり

translation.en: It also gave the city a release...
translation.ja: 解放でもあった

translation.en: ...because, throughout the '90s, the reality of black life in New Orleans was entirely different.
translation.ja: 90年代地元の黒人の生活は―

translation.en: NOLA was besieged by drugs and violence, with the highest homicide rates in America.
translation.ja: 麻薬や暴力にまみれ殺人件数は全国１位

translation.en: This was the other side of New Orleans, but you wouldn't find it on a bounce record.

translation.en: NOLA needed a different outlet,

translation.en: and it would be a shrewd hustler from NOLA's Third Ward who would bring this reality to the world.
translation.ja: それを表現したのは３区出身のハスラー

translation.en: [Master P] These little kids ain't even five or six years old.

translation.en: They done seen murders right there, on the spot.

translation.en: You know, I seen a murder at four years old right here.

translation.en: At the time,
translation.ja: 当時は最も危険な場所だった

translation.en: it was one of the most dangerous places in the world to live.
translation.ja: 当時は最も危険な場所だった 当時は最も危険な場所だったマスターＰ 当時は最も危険な場所だった

translation.en: Most of the crimes that happened in New Orleans, probably half of it happened in the Caliope Projects.
translation.ja: ニューオーリンズの犯罪の大半はここで起きていた

translation.en: This is for real.
translation.ja: マジだよ

translation.en: [male] The City of New Orleans and the hoods been at war since we were kids.
translation.ja: ガキの頃から警察ともめてたエリア

translation.en: Yeah, I was in the military, I went to Desert Storm.

translation.en: What was the difference?

translation.en: Only thing, they just had bigger guns and missiles.

translation.en: [reporter] New Orleans has a record of homicides this year.

translation.en: It has by far the highest murder rate of any big city in the nation.
translation.ja: 全国トップの件数です

translation.en: Five times the number of murders in cities of comparable size.

translation.en: [Master P] You know, me and brother Kevin,
translation.ja: 兄弟のケビンと―

translation.en: we used to sit in the projects and say, "Who gonna die first?"
translation.ja: どっちが先に死ぬかと話してた

translation.en: If you lived to be 19, you a OG in the projects.
translation.ja: 19歳まで生きれば立派

translation.en: That was our magic number, man. If we could live to be 19, you know, we'd made it.
translation.ja: 19は憧れの数字だったよ

translation.en: And, I mean, he died at that age.
translation.ja: 彼はその歳で死んだ

translation.en: And, that just-- that tore something out of my heart.
translation.ja: 心が引き裂かれたんだ

translation.en: You know, when I watched my mom,
translation.ja: 母は泣き崩れ

translation.en: her whole world turned upside down, and I'm like, "I don't wanna keep putting her through this.
translation.ja: 彼女にそんな思いをさせたくなかった

translation.en: I have to do something better with my life." That's what really made me go hard with the music.
translation.ja: 人生を変えたくて音楽に熱中し始めた

translation.en: You know, I named my company "No Limit," because there's gonna be no limit to my success,
translation.ja: 成功にリミットはないノーリミットさ

translation.en: and I named myself "Master P" because I said I'm gonna master whatever I do.
translation.ja: 全てマスターしたくてマスターＰにした

translation.en: I was listening to Ice-T, "Colors." "I am a nightmare walking, psychopath talking."
translation.ja: アイスＴの〝カラーズ〞を聞いて

translation.en: That music did something for me.
translation.ja: 何かが変わった

translation.en: You know, hearing the bounce music, it was a lot of party music, which was a good sound for New Orleans,

translation.en: but I felt like we were missing something, you know?

translation.en: Seeing so many people die young, seeing the crime, seeing the poverty.
translation.ja: 若い命が奪われ犯罪や貧困を見てきて

translation.en: You know, it just poured out of me. I was able to tell my story.

translation.en: You see a bunch of mansions around here?

translation.en: -Do you? -No.

translation.en: Okay. Well, that's reality. That's what I'm talking about.
translation.ja: この現実を伝えたいんだ

translation.en: [Master P] I built No Limit on $10,000.
translation.ja: 資本金は１万ドル

translation.en: I put up my own posters. I went to every hood.

translation.en: I started taking my van, and going from hood to hood, selling my CDs.
translation.ja: 自分の車で街中回ってＣＤを手売りして

translation.en: That's the whole thing. I started selling it out of the trunk.
translation.ja: 車のトランクから売ってた

translation.en: I mean, we would be in DC, and here's the thing,

translation.en: we weren't supposed to be in DC.
translation.ja: ＤＣの危険な場所にも行った

translation.en: That's like somebody going into Compton or whatever.
translation.ja: コンプトンに行くように

translation.en: We were just so about hustling, we didn't care about the dangers. It's all we have, so we here.
translation.ja: 危険もかえりみずどこへでも行った

translation.en: And people were like, "Y'all crazy enough to come in the neighborhood,
translation.ja: “こんな所に来るなんて”

translation.en: you know what? Gimme the CD."
translation.ja: “ＣＤくれ”ってね

translation.en: [Gregory D] No Limit, that wasn't no, you know, no bounce shit.

translation.en: You could hear a hard life in that music,

translation.en: but that's the way of life in New Orleans. We gutter.
translation.ja: それがニューオーリンズのどん底生活

translation.en: We gutter, bro. We gutter. We so goddamn gutter.
translation.ja: マジでどん底だ

translation.en: And the street cats, they wanna hear what they can relate to.

translation.en: [Ricky B] Master P, when he hit the scene,

translation.en: everybody was like, "Okay,"
translation.ja: ニューオーリンズのサウンドじゃなかった ニューオーリンズのサウンドじゃなかったリッキーＢ

translation.en: but it wasn't that New Orleans sound.
translation.ja: ニューオーリンズのサウンドじゃなかった

translation.en: So, we had to kind of learn,  "Okay, what's going on with No Limit?"
translation.ja: ノーリミットが何か知る必要があったんだ

translation.en: [female] A lot of people didn't like his music in the beginning, right?

translation.en: Bitches all used to be throwing that man's fucking CDs back at him.
translation.ja: 彼に向かってＣＤを投げ返してたよ 彼に向かってＣＤを投げ返してたよＭ＄ティー

translation.en: I remember that.
translation.ja: 彼に向かってＣＤを投げ返してたよＭ＄ティー

translation.en: It seemed when Master P started dominating outskirts,

translation.en: then New Orleans was like, "Master P!" New Orleans is, like, an ass-kissing city.
translation.ja: 手のひらを返して応援し始めたわ

translation.en: They gonna like you after the fact.

translation.en: I remember buying a CD and a cassette from Percy Miller
translation.ja: フィンドラッパー彼からＣＤやカセットを買ったよ 彼からＣＤやカセットを買ったよ

translation.en: before I knew him or even worked with him, because I felt like,
translation.ja: まだ一緒に仕事をする前だ

translation.en: "I'm gonna support this dude, man. He out here selling his own stuff."
translation.ja: 手売りしてる奴を応援したくて

translation.en: I'll never forget this, because he had his socks way up to here,
translation.ja: ここまでの靴下を履いてて

translation.en: and I'm like, "Man, what's this dude doing with his socks way up to here?"
translation.ja: ここまでの靴下を履いてて “何だコイツ？”と思ったよ

translation.en: I'm not clowning him,

translation.en: I'm just saying that he was confident in who he was,
translation.ja: バカにしてるんじゃない 彼の自信はドープだった

translation.en: and I just thought that was dope.
translation.ja: 彼の自信はドープだった

translation.en: I was different, you know.
translation.ja: 俺は変わってた

translation.en: It might give you a slow start,

translation.en: but being different is going to carry you a long way.

translation.en: [Master P] We got a whole different plan.

translation.en: They can't stop us, because, eventually, we gonna leak in.

translation.en: P wanted to be respected as a major label, which meant that you had to put out more records.
translation.ja: 彼はメジャーレベルと肩を並べたくて

translation.en: He scoured the city,

translation.en: and he did what I like to call "corporate raiding."
translation.ja: 企業に奇襲を仕掛けた

translation.en: He raided every label and got their top artists.
translation.ja: あらゆるレーベルの人気アーティストを狙った

translation.en: [Mia X] Master P came to my house, and he just explained to me
translation.ja: ミアＸ マスターＰが家に来て

translation.en: what his plans were for No Limit. And, he was like,
translation.ja: ノーリミットの計画を語り始めた

translation.en: "It's an independent label, but they're gonna look at it like a major label. I'm gonna make history,
translation.ja: インディーズだけどメジャーとして見られる

translation.en: and it's gonna be big, and I want you to be a part of it."
translation.ja: その大きな歴史に関わって欲しいと

translation.en: It was something about the way he said it, I could feel it.
translation.ja: 彼の言葉には何かがあった

translation.en: I knew that he was gonna do what he said he was gonna do.
translation.ja: その力を信じさせてくれた

translation.en: [KLC] P got the greatest MCs from the city.
translation.ja: 最高のＭＣを集めた

translation.en: He had Mystikal, Soulja Slim. Everybody came there.
translation.ja: ミスティカルやソルジャ·スリム

translation.en: It was just, like, open house to whoever wanna rap,
translation.ja: 誰でも大歓迎だった

translation.en: and then you had five people doing beats for you.
translation.ja: ビートを作る５人

translation.en: Beats By The Pound.
translation.ja: ビーツ·バイザ·パウンド

translation.en: So, as soon as he finished a song, we pulling up the next.
translation.ja: ビーツ·バイザ·パウンド 次から次へ曲を作る

translation.en: Relentless hustle.
translation.ja: 次から次へ曲を作る

translation.en: No Limit was like a big-ass freestyle.
translation.ja: 大規模なフリースタイル

translation.en: P fed off of everybody.
translation.ja: Ｐは全員から吸収し

translation.en: This is how it all formed for No Limit to become what it is.
translation.ja: そうやってノーリミットができた

translation.en: All of us being together in the studio, 24/7,
translation.ja: みんなスタジオに24時間こもって

translation.en: you know, songs were just cranking out of us.
translation.ja: どんどん曲ができた

translation.en: I felt like I had the best of the best for us making music.
translation.ja: 音楽が作れる優秀な奴らが集まった

translation.en: So, when I heard the beat for "Make 'Em Say Uhh!",
translation.ja: “メイク·エム·セイ·アー”のビートを聞き

translation.en: I felt like I needed to put this city on the map.
translation.ja: “メイク·エム·セイ·アー”のビートを聞き 地元を代表したいと思った

translation.en: [Fiend] "Make 'Em Say Uhh!", man.
translation.ja: あの曲ができた時

translation.en: He turned around and said, "Look, this is gonna be a big song, a big-ass song,
translation.ja: みんなでヤベェ曲になると言って

translation.en: and everybody gonna wanna get on here.
translation.ja: 誰もが参加したがった

translation.en: Whoever ready with their verse is getting on here, and that's gonna be the order."
translation.ja: バースができた奴から順番に録る

translation.en: I remember writing on the wall, piece of paper, I was ready.
translation.ja: 壁で紙切れに書いて

translation.en: "A'ight, Fiend, you go ahead," you know. He didn't ask to hear it.
translation.ja: 聞く前に“お前がやれ”って

translation.en: I went up in there,
translation.ja: ラップした

translation.en: "Fiend exercising his right of exorcism, bustin' out the Expedition"
translation.ja: ”フィンドの悪魔祓いブチかます”

translation.en: [Fiend] No Limit Records, it was all these artists, producers, all sharing this type of energy,
translation.ja: アーティストやプロデューサーの―

translation.en: moving as one unit.
translation.ja: エネルギーが団結して

translation.en: And, it just became something to be reckoned with, man.
translation.ja: 注目され始めたんだ

translation.en: ♪ Make ‘em say uhh, uhh ♪
translation.ja: 〝メイク·エム·セイアー〞マスターＰ

translation.en: [KLC] "Make 'Em Say Uhh!" was our first big mainstream record.
translation.ja: あの曲が最初のヒット曲

translation.en: That was the first record that went everywhere.
translation.ja: そこら中でかかってた

translation.en: You know, that was all your work, you know, everything that you put into this, here's your trophy for it.
translation.ja: 今までの努力が実ったトロフィーだった

translation.en: Y'all don't understand. 1998, we put out 26 albums.
translation.ja: 1998年には26枚アルバムを出した

translation.en: They were like, "How did y'all do this shit? How in the fuck y'all do it?"
translation.ja: “一体どうやって？”と驚かれたよ

translation.en: In '98, things were just going at a crazy pace.
translation.ja: 98年のペースはクレイジーだった

translation.en: I'd imagine that time would be a bit of a blur,
translation.ja: 98年のペースはクレイジーだったクレイグＢプロデューサー クレイグＢプロデューサー クレイグＢプロデューサー当時何を覚えてる？

translation.en: but what do you remember of the process?
translation.ja: 当時何を覚えてる？

translation.en: It was like a factory, you know.
translation.ja: まるで工場さ

translation.en: It was like a factory, but, we had fun doing it.
translation.ja: でも楽しんで作ってた

translation.en: Albums were getting done quick.
translation.ja: 作業は早かった

translation.en: You had five producers.
translation.ja: プロデューサー５人

translation.en: I go to you, I don't even get time to listen to it. Now I go in the next room to him,
translation.ja: 聞く間もなく次の部屋に行って

translation.en: and keep coming back around 'til my album was done.
translation.ja: 完成するまで人から人へ

translation.en: [Mia X] I wrote and recorded 16 songs in 10 days,
translation.ja: 10日で16曲作って録音した

translation.en: and it came out number two in the Top 200,
translation.ja: それがトップ200で２位に

translation.en: and the only person that was on top of me was Céline Dion.
translation.ja: １位はセリーヌ·ディオン

translation.en: Now, how could you be mad at that? That's Céline Dion!
translation.ja: 彼女には怒れないわ！

translation.en: You know, I remember going to KLC's house.
translation.ja: ＫＬＣの家に行くと

translation.en: The wall was five, six, seven times longer than this wall.
translation.ja: この壁の５〜６倍の長さの壁に―デビッド·バナー この壁の５〜６倍の長さの壁に―

translation.en: They had plaques as far as you could see. The whole wall was filled with plaques.
translation.ja: 見渡す限りディスクが飾ってあった

translation.en: Them boys did more in a year
translation.ja: 普通のレーベルのリリース総数以上を―

translation.en: than most record companies do in their whole tenure.
translation.ja: 普通のレーベルのリリース総数以上を― 彼らは１年でリリースした

translation.en: I love all y'all niggas, for real.
translation.ja: マジで愛してるぜ

translation.en: All you motherfuckers that kept it real with No Limit.
translation.ja: ノーリミットを支えてくれた奴ら

translation.en: I made my motherfucking money the right way.
translation.ja: 正しいやり方で稼いだぜ

translation.en: [Charles] This is the turning point for New Orleans music.
translation.ja: これがターニングポイント

translation.en: P, as an independent, had a distribution deal
translation.ja: ディストリビューション契約も果たし

translation.en: which means that they are actually standalone labels
translation.ja: ディストリビューション契約も果たし レーベルとして音楽性をコントロールできて

translation.en: that have total control of their own music,
translation.ja: レーベルとして音楽性をコントロールできて

translation.en: and they get the majority of the money.
translation.ja: 利益の大半をもらえた

translation.en: That's unheard of.
translation.ja: 前代未聞だよ

translation.en: They awakened a sleeping giant in Southern hip-hop,
translation.ja: 南部のヒップホップの怪物の目を覚ませた

translation.en: because labels looked at P and said, "If he can do it, we can do it."
translation.ja: 他のレーベルも”俺らにもできる”ってね

translation.en: Me going up against the music industry independently,
translation.ja: インディーズで音楽業界に立ち向かった

translation.en: without having to sell your soul,
translation.ja: 魂も売らず

translation.en: and being an African-American kid from New Orleans is unheard of.
translation.ja: ニューオーリンズ出身の黒人として前代未聞だ

translation.en: Talk about hustle, I am the best hustler
translation.ja: 俺は最高のハスラー

translation.en: that ever came out of Louisiana, New Orleans, the South.
translation.ja: ルイジアナや南部を代表して

translation.en: [narrator] Master P and No Limit put New Orleans on the map in hip-hop,
translation.ja: 彼はニューオーリンズの名を広め

translation.en: but while No Limit's hardcore style sold major units,
translation.ja: 大ヒットを飛ばしたが

translation.en: their sound was still a departure for the city.
translation.ja: サウンドはよそ者だった

translation.en: New Orleans was still ruled by bounce, but in the duality of the city, there was an opportunity.
translation.ja: 地元でバウンスが流行する中チャンスが訪れた

translation.en: And NOLA had no shortage of hard-working hustlers,
translation.ja: 努力家のハスラー

translation.en: including a pair of brothers from the city's tough Magnolia Projects,
translation.ja: マグノリア団地出身の兄弟が―

translation.en: who would follow Master P's blueprint for independent success.
translation.ja: マスターＰの成功を追った

translation.en: [male] We the millennium.
translation.ja: キャシュマネーレコーズ 俺らの時代

translation.en: We've come to take this game and bring it to me.
translation.ja: 俺たちの手でつかむぞ

translation.en: We gonna be here. I ain't no fly-by-night nigga.
translation.ja: 一発屋じゃねぇ

translation.en: Gonna be here two years, three years. I got this shit.
translation.ja: ２〜３年先もやるぞ

translation.en: [Mannie Fresh] I met Baby and Slim. I was DJing in the Caliope,
translation.ja: カリオペでＤＪしてた時ベイビーとスリムに会った

translation.en: and that's way out of my area.
translation.ja: カリオペでＤＪしてた時ベイビーとスリムに会った 俺のエリア外

translation.en: But every week, the drug dealers had me there,
translation.ja: でも毎週ヤクの売人に呼ばれた

translation.en: because they wanted to keep that crowd out there.
translation.ja: 客を集めるためにね

translation.en: Baby and them were there. He was just like, "I wanna make records
translation.ja: 彼らは曲を作りたいと言って

translation.en: and I think you're the dude, you know, that could bring it to the next level."
translation.ja: 手伝ってほしいと言われた

translation.en: I think Baby could sell space heaters in hell.
translation.ja: ベイビーは口が上手い

translation.en: This dude will give you a speech, and y'all could be down by a hundred points,
translation.ja: 百点差で負けてたとしても

translation.en: and he can make your ass believe that you're going to win that game.
translation.ja: 彼に説得されたら勝てると信じられる

translation.en: Now, at the time, they had an artist called Kilo G,
translation.ja: キロＧという奴がいて

translation.en: and I'm going, "That's cool, but bounce is popular right now. Let's try a bounce record and see what happens."
translation.ja: 俺は 人気のバウンス曲を作ろうと言った

translation.en: Well, I'd heard about these dudes from my dad, called U.N.L.V.
translation.ja: 親父からＵＮＬＶの話を聞いた

translation.en: They were three little dudes who would just go around, rapping off of breakbeats or whatever,
translation.ja: ビートに乗せてラップする３人組

translation.en: but they had a following.
translation.ja: ファンもいた

translation.en: You know, there were only, like, three different labels in New Orleans,
translation.ja: リル·ヤＵＮＬＶ地元のレーベルは３つぐらいで 地元のレーベルは３つぐらいで

translation.en: and they was one of them, and they were trying to get their label off the ground,
translation.ja: 彼らもその１つまだ奮闘中で

translation.en: and we weren't even in the studio. We recorded our first album in Mannie Fresh's kitchen, as a matter of fact.
translation.ja: スタジオもなくマニー家の台所で録音したよ

translation.en: Every album that we had done a lot of numbers, you know. We did real well with them.
translation.ja: アルバムの売れ行きは好調だった

translation.en: We opened the doors for them to sign other artists,
translation.ja: おかげでアーティストが増え

translation.en: added a little more revenue.
translation.ja: 利益も上がった

translation.en: And, what we were doing differently, we were actually using the bounce tracks,
translation.ja: 俺らが違ってたのはバウンスのトラックに―

translation.en: but we were putting gangsta lyrics on top of it.
translation.ja: ギャングスタリリックを乗せた

translation.en: [M$. Tee] What was different about Cash Money was, we were telling stories with our bounce.
translation.ja: キャッシュマネーはバウンスに物語を乗せた

translation.en: We had the catchy beats or whatever,
translation.ja: 踊れるビートだけど

translation.en: but it was more of a reality bounce.
translation.ja: リアルさがあるバウンス

translation.en: [interviewer] Baby and Slim, what do you remember of that relationship?
translation.ja: ベイビーとスリムの関係は？

translation.en: Like, did they have different roles in Cash Money?
translation.ja: それぞれ役割があった？

translation.en: What I can say about them, they knew how to pick talent.
translation.ja: 彼らの強みは才能を見抜く力

translation.en: Oh, my god, bro, they have a gift.
translation.ja: すごかったわ

translation.en: Baby and Slim, they were always looking for new artists.
translation.ja: いつも新人を探してた

translation.en: You know, we had U.N.L.V. for a long time,
translation.ja: ＵＮＬＶがいたけど

translation.en: but it was, you know, it was time for a new little era.
translation.ja: 新しい時代が来てた

translation.en: We knew what time it was.
translation.ja: 時代が変わるとわかったよ

translation.en: I think it was, it was, like, a part of Baby and Slim's strategy
translation.ja: 時代が変わるとわかったよ ベイビーとスリムの戦略で

translation.en: to almost recreate a U.N.L.V., but also add more to the company.
translation.ja: ＵＮＬＶを再現しつつ拡大させたんだ

translation.en: [narrator] Cash Money's vision for reality bounce was a turning point for the label,
translation.ja: リアルなバウンスは転換期となったが

translation.en: but they needed rappers to pull it off,
translation.ja: ラッパーが必要だった

translation.en: and who better than a prodigy of the bounce scene:
translation.ja: バウンスシーンの申し子

translation.en: A gold-toothed rapper who got his start with DJ Jimi,
translation.ja: ＤＪジミーと始めた金歯のラッパー

translation.en: and went by the name of Juvenile.
translation.ja: ジュヴィナイル

translation.en: -Glad you made it. -Thank you so much.
translation.ja: 来てくれて感謝だ

translation.en: Let's do it.
translation.ja: ああ

translation.en: [interviewer] So, why don't we just start at the beginning, and tell me how you connected with DJ Jimi.
translation.ja: ＤＪジミーと知り合ったきっかけは？

translation.en: [Juvenile] I mean, I started off rapping at the block parties.
translation.ja: ブロックパーティーで

translation.en: It was only, like, a couple of us who could actually walk up,
translation.ja: 何人かがマイク取ってラップし始めた 何人かがマイク取ってラップし始めたジュヴィナイルラッパー

translation.en: grab the microphone, and just start running it.
translation.ja: 何人かがマイク取ってラップし始めたジュヴィナイルラッパー

translation.en: And, shit, I was one of them. I was upper echelon.
translation.ja: 俺もその１人で

translation.en: Jimi got an opportunity to take me to the studio. When I got in there, I realized I was gonna be the writer.
translation.ja: ジミーにスタジオに連れて行ってもらったら

translation.en: You know, I thought I was going in there to do songs for myself.
translation.ja: 自分の曲を書くことになった

translation.en: I wrote damn near every song on the album.
translation.ja: ほぼアルバム全曲

translation.en: "Bounce (For The Juvenile)," I did that just to put my name out there.
translation.ja: “バウンス”は自分の名を広めるために作った

translation.en: Like, it was a slick way of getting on his album.
translation.ja: 彼のアルバムに入りたくて

translation.en: [Juvenile] The "Bounce (For The Juvenile)" song actually blew up.
translation.ja: あの曲は大ヒット

translation.en: It made record companies pay attention to the little cat in the background.
translation.ja: レーベルにも注目された

translation.en: You know what I'm saying, like, "Wait, hold up. So he wrote all that?"
translation.ja: “コイツが書いたのか？”って

translation.en: I was actually at the bus stop on Canal Street.
translation.ja: カナル通りのバス停で

translation.en: Baby and them pulled up on me, like "Man, I wanna talk to you."
translation.ja: ベイビーらに声かけられた

translation.en: They picked me up from the bus stop, man, took me to the studio.
translation.ja: バス停からスタジオに行き

translation.en: I ain't never looked back.
translation.ja: それっきりだ

translation.en: [Mannie Fresh] Juvie was established, but it's this other kid, he's a prodigy, nuts, he can rap.
translation.ja: ジュヴィの他にもう１人ラップの天才児がいた

translation.en: It's Lil Wayne. Now, at the time, Lil Wayne is 11, 12, something like that.
translation.ja: 当時はまだ12歳のリル·ウェイン

translation.en: Magnolia Shorty, rest in peace, she was like, "Hey, I know a little guy, Turk. Nice on the mic." She brings him in.
translation.ja: マグノリアショーティーが紹介したターク

translation.en: And BG, he's from Baby and them's block.
translation.ja: ベイビーらの仲間ＢＧ

translation.en: So, now we got four solo dudes,
translation.ja: ４人のソロが揃った

translation.en: and I get this idea to say, like: "Dude, this is what we gonna do.
translation.ja: そこで思いついたんだ

translation.en: To build everybody else's career off of this, I'm gonna put y'all together
translation.ja: キャリアの土台作りにグループにする

translation.en: and become The Hot Boys.
translation.ja: それがホットボーイズ

translation.en: It was almost like a boy band, some thug boy band group.
translation.ja: 悪ガキアイドルみたいなもんだよ

translation.en: It was the whole movement of, you know,
translation.ja: 大きなムーブメント

translation.en: you want people to turn into this. You want people to turn into, "I want to be like these dudes."
translation.ja: みんなの憧れの存在にさせたい

translation.en: [Juvenile] BG's straight gangster, straight street.
translation.ja: ＢＧは生粋のストリート

translation.en: Wayne, real witty, clever with words.
translation.ja: ウェインは言葉が巧み

translation.en: Turk was the freak of the clique, and I'm the old dude. -[interviewer laughing] -Straight up.
translation.ja: タークは変わり者俺が最年長ってわけさ

translation.en: It was really the actual transformation of Cash Money.
translation.ja: キャッシュマネーの転換期

translation.en: They let all the other artists go. I mean, everybody.
translation.ja: 他のアーティストは解約した

translation.en: The room went from a room full of people
translation.ja: 人でいっぱいだったのが―

translation.en: to five or six people,
translation.ja: ５〜６人になった

translation.en: and that's including the producer, Baby, Slim, and the groups.
translation.ja: プロデューサーやベイビーらも含めて

translation.en: The fingers were just pointing at, "Now y'all gotta do it."
translation.ja: 俺らに全ての期待が向いた

translation.en: [Mannie Fresh] The whole concept of how MCs worked off each other, like back in the G.
translation.ja: ゲットーみたいにＭＣが刺激し合う

translation.en: That was my thought on how I was gonna work The Hot Boys. A modern day Furious Five.
translation.ja: 現代版のフュリアス５みたいだよ

translation.en: At the time, it was the leather thing
translation.ja: その当時はレザーが流行ってた

translation.en: that they did, or whatever, but it was the uniform.
translation.ja: その当時はレザーが流行ってた 同じ服で一緒に行動して

translation.en: Everybody had the same thing on. Everybody moved as one.
translation.ja: 同じ服で一緒に行動して

translation.en: It was the bandana, the long white Ts.
translation.ja: バンダナに白いロングＴ

translation.en: [Juvenile] Damn, dawg. It's the Furious Five redub.
translation.ja: フュリアス５の再現さ

translation.en: I'm Melle Mel in there. They're jealous. I can't be nobody else but Melle Mel.
translation.ja: 俺はメレ·メル嫉妬されたぜ

translation.en: [Juvenile] Damn, I didn't know that's how he saw that.
translation.ja: そう見てたのか

translation.en: The look is the Magnolia.
translation.ja: キャッシュマネーと始める前から―

translation.en: Before we even got around, did anything with Cash Money,
translation.ja: キャッシュマネーと始める前から― Ｔシャツ ジーンズにリーボック

translation.en: we were wearing T-shirts, Girbauds and Reeboks.
translation.ja: Ｔシャツ ジーンズにリーボック

translation.en: We got packs of T-shirts, and packs of rags, and boxes of soldiers.
translation.ja: Ｔシャツやバンダナを箱で用意して

translation.en: Man, we would show up to an event,
translation.ja: イベントの衣装も―

translation.en: and they'd see us earlier that day, and they all think we had the same clothes on,
translation.ja: その日の私服と全く同じ

translation.en: "Yo man, that's bad. We gotta change our wardrobe."
translation.ja: 衣装替えが必要だぜ

translation.en: [Juvenile] We are Hot Boys. We fires that can't be put out.
translation.ja: 俺らの炎は消せない

translation.en: You could call every fire engine truck in the United States and let 'em wet us down,
translation.ja: アメリカ中の消防車集めても消せねぇ

translation.en: but we still gonna burn.
translation.ja: 燃え続ける

translation.en: We still gonna burn.
translation.ja: ずっとね

translation.en: It was undeniable, because all of them were dope artists. Dope rappers, dope lyricists,
translation.ja: メンバー全員ドープなラッパーだった

translation.en: and you had the sound that Mannie Fresh had introduced,
translation.ja: マニー·フレッシュの生んだバウンスに―

translation.en: which was bounce, but with a twist.
translation.ja: 一捻(ひね)り効いてた

translation.en: You know, you just wanna get rowdy with it. And, that resonated everywhere.
translation.ja: 騒ぎたくなる音楽で大きな反響だった

translation.en: People liked that raunchy sound, that "let's get wild" sound.
translation.ja: “バカ騒ぎしよう”ってサウンドだ

translation.en: [M$. Tee] They did a big impact with The Hot Boys. Everybody wanted to be like them,
translation.ja: 誰もがホットボーイズに憧れて―

translation.en: with the white T-shirts, and the Girbauds on.
translation.ja: 白Ｔシャツにジルボーのジーンズ

translation.en: Everybody with the do-rag on.
translation.ja: バンダナ

translation.en: Nobody was putting no suits on.
translation.ja: スーツじゃない

translation.en: They did so much independently. I mean, like, a lot.
translation.ja: インディーズですごく売れると―

translation.en: But, when you selling a lot on your own, record companies start looking at that.
translation.ja: レコード会社が注目しだす

translation.en: [Juvenile] That whole record deal with Universal,
translation.ja: ユニバーサルとの契約は業界にとって衝撃だった

translation.en: it was a shock to the music industry.
translation.ja: ユニバーサルとの契約は業界にとって衝撃だった ユニバーサルとの契約は業界にとって衝撃だった 〝３千万ドル契約〞

translation.en: I feel like they didn't understand
translation.ja: 〝３千万ドル契約〞 〝３千万ドル契約〞 俺らがこんなにアルバムを出すことや― 俺らがこんなにアルバムを出すことや―

translation.en: that we were gonna put out a decent amount of albums.
translation.ja: 俺らがこんなにアルバムを出すことや―

translation.en: The quality of the sound.
translation.ja: クオリティーに―

translation.en: Like, they didn't know, really, like "Who are these cats?
translation.ja: 奴らは気づいてなかった

translation.en: What did they do to get 30 million dollars?"
translation.ja: 30万ドル契約だって？

translation.en: It was a fun time for us.
translation.ja: 楽しかったぜ

translation.en: How the hell are y'all out there?
translation.ja: 調子はどうだ？

translation.en: [male] Put the light on them bitches. That's a hundred Gs, player.
translation.ja: 光をつけてやるよゴールドだぜ

translation.en: You see the bling in 'em?
translation.ja: 見えるか？

translation.en: Get a good shot of 'em, cousin.
translation.ja: 撮ってくれよ

translation.en: [Lil Ya] Cash Money was always known for a flossing label.
translation.ja: キャッシュマネーは派手好きで

translation.en: The stunting thing came about when the big deal came,
translation.ja: メジャーからの大金を得たベイビーとスリムは―

translation.en: the world knew that Baby and Slim signed and had a lot of money,
translation.ja: メジャーからの大金を得たベイビーとスリムは― もっと見せびらかし始めた

translation.en: and Baby also got the opportunity to really come front line.
translation.ja: ベイビーも表に出て来るきっかけになった

translation.en: Let me know everything there is to know about Cash Money.
translation.ja: キャッシュマネーとは？

translation.en: A'ight. First thing to know about us,
translation.ja: 教えてやる

translation.en: I got the rap game on lock. You must know that first.
translation.ja: 第一にラップは俺らのもの

translation.en: Can't nothing or nobody fake what we trying to do and what we about to do.
translation.ja: 誰にもマネできねぇ事をしてやる

translation.en: Second thing is,
translation.ja: ２つ目は―

translation.en: we got this game on our level.
translation.ja: 俺らだけのレベル

translation.en: Y'all understand what I'm saying?
translation.ja: わかるか？

translation.en: [Mannie Fresh] Now, Cash Money is solidified. You had BG fans,
translation.ja: キャッシュマネーは確立された

translation.en: you had Lil Wayne fans, you had Turk fans and you had Juvenile fans.
translation.ja: メンバー全員にファンがついて

translation.en: They gave everybody a platform. To build everybody else's career off of this,
translation.ja: それぞれのキャリアの土台になった

translation.en: now we really gonna break y'all down into solo artists.
translation.ja: みんなソロデビュー

translation.en: Next week, we doing Juvenile's album.
translation.ja: 翌週はジュヴィのアルバム

translation.en: Cash Money had been out, but they hadn't gotten to where No Limit was yet.
translation.ja: 彼らはノーリミットには追いついてなかった

translation.en: And then, when that 400 Degreez album came out,
translation.ja: アルバム〝４００ディグリーズ〞で―

translation.en: it took over as the number one  rap sound in New Orleans.
translation.ja: ニューオーリンズのラッブサウンドに

translation.en: Always in the back of our minds, we was... We had to do real good on our art,
translation.ja: いつも頭の裏には― ノーリミットを越えたい思いがあった

translation.en: try to be better than No Limit.
translation.ja: ノーリミットを越えたい思いがあった

translation.en: Not saying that we were chasing them.
translation.ja: 追ってたんじゃない

translation.en: They were the ones in the game. Like, if you gonna beat anybody in the music game,
translation.ja: ここでは彼らが頂点だったから

translation.en: or compete with anybody coming from New Orleans,
translation.ja: ニューオーリンズから成功したけりゃ―

translation.en: you gotta at least be close
translation.ja: ニューオーリンズから成功したけりゃ― 追いつく必要があった

translation.en: to where No Limit at.
translation.ja: 追いつく必要があった

translation.en: We went from here, to here,
translation.ja: 下からのぼりつめて

translation.en: and I knew, you gotta follow up. Especially on a national album.
translation.ja: アルバムは成功させたかった

translation.en: At the time, I really felt like if anybody was gonna make a bounce record,
translation.ja: 当時 誰かが― バウンスで世界的に成功するとしたら

translation.en: and make everybody like it and break it to the world,
translation.ja: バウンスで世界的に成功するとしたら

translation.en: it was going to be me. That was my focus.
translation.ja: 俺しかいない

translation.en: I was like, "Just gimme a real fast beat and let me go."
translation.ja: “速いビートをくれ”って

translation.en: [Mannie Fresh] The beat was a bounce beat,
translation.ja: バウンスビートだが

translation.en: but what made "Back That Azz Up" different was it had structure to it.
translation.ja: “Back That Azz Up”は曲の構成があった

translation.en: It had a chorus, it had a bridge.
translation.ja: “Back That Azz Up”は曲の構成があった サビやブリッジ

translation.en: I started incorporating more music to these beats.
translation.ja: 他の音楽も取り入れ始めた

translation.en: The top part of it was classical music.
translation.ja: トップはクラシック

translation.en: At that moment, hip-hop was going crazy,
translation.ja: 当時は大騒ぎだったよ

translation.en: because nobody was doing where the song broke down,
translation.ja: 他の誰もやってなかった

translation.en: and there was this part for these girls to go nuts.
translation.ja: 女子が騒ぐパートなんて

translation.en: [Mannie Fresh] All of that won it over. It crossed over to both worlds.
translation.ja: 両方の客層に響いたんだ

translation.en: I was like, "Holy shit."
translation.ja: マジヤバかった

translation.en: [Big Freedia] "Back That Azz Up" was rapping over more of a bounce beat.
translation.ja: あの曲はバウンスビートで

translation.en: Like, we got one that's gonna put the limelight on New Orleans, and repping the sound of New Orleans.
translation.ja: ニューオーリンズのサウンドを広めてくれた

translation.en: [DJ Jimi] "Back That Azz Up" showed them twerking, you know.
translation.ja: トゥワークを見せつけて

translation.en: They took it out. They took it more nationwide.
translation.ja: 全国にまで広まった

translation.en: From it being local to now everybody knew about this.
translation.ja: ローカルから― 誰もが知るアーティストへ

translation.en: [M$. Tee] When Juvie came through, it was something fresh,
translation.ja: ジュヴィは新鮮で―

translation.en: it was something new, it was something that nobody else was doing. He just had an original vibe.
translation.ja: 他の誰にもない独自のバイブスがあった

translation.en: It was awesome!
translation.ja: 最高だったわ

translation.en: I'm a girl, nigga, and I went and bought that fucking CD!
translation.ja: 女の私もＣＤ買ったぐらい

translation.en: [Mannie Fresh] Everything after that  was certified platinum record from Cash Money.
translation.ja: それ以降プラチナレコード続き

translation.en: It's one of the longest lasting labels that's been around.
translation.ja: 息が長いレーベルだよ

translation.en: [Master P] That's their legacy. I'm proud of them. I'm happy for them that they went on their own.
translation.ja: 彼らがやり遂げたことを誇りに思うよ

translation.en: I think it was a good time for New Orleans,
translation.ja: 俺たちのいい時代だった

translation.en: so where we were the first and they came right behind us.
translation.ja: 俺らの後を追って来て

translation.en: It showed the world what we were about,
translation.ja: 世界中に知らしめた

translation.en: what we stood for,
translation.ja: 俺らの主張

translation.en: the pain, the struggle, the hustle.
translation.ja: 痛みや苦労

translation.en: It represented the culture.
translation.ja: 俺らの文化を代表した

translation.en: [narrator] Luke Records, Rap-A-Lot, LaFace.
translation.ja: ルーク ラップ·アロットラ·フェイス

translation.en: Until New Orleans came along, these were the labels that defined the South,
translation.ja: それまで南部を代表したレーベルを超え―

translation.en: but the countless platinum plaques that No Limit and Cash Money stacked were unparalleled.
translation.ja: ノーリミットやキャッシュマネーは―

translation.en: And, more importantly, the deals they made as independents redefined how success was measured in hip-hop.
translation.ja: インディーズとして画期的な契約を勝ち取った

translation.en: It was yet another milestone for the South,
translation.ja: 南部の新たな躍進

translation.en: and further proof that by drawing on their own history,
translation.ja: 彼らはさらに自らのルーツをたどり

translation.en: the South could keep bending the contours of hip-hop.
translation.ja: 彼らはさらに自らのルーツをたどり ヒップホップの音色を変えることになる

translation.en: And, that's exactly what they were going to do.
translation.ja: ヒップホップの音色を変えることになる
